Question: What does HTML stand for?
Explanation: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.

Question: Which tag is used to define an HTML paragraph?
Explanation:
The

tag is used to define a paragraph in HTML.

Question: Which tag is used to define an HTML heading?
Explanation: The <h1> tag is used to define the main heading in HTML.

Question: Which attribute is used to specify the URL in an anchor tag?
Explanation: The href attribute is used to specify the URL in an anchor tag (<a>).

Question: Which tag is used to create an unordered list?
Explanation: The <ul> tag is used to create an unordered list in HTML.

Question: Which tag is used to create a table in HTML?
Explanation: The <table> tag is used to define a table in HTML.

Question: Which attribute is used to specify the image source in HTML?
Explanation: The src attribute is used to specify the source of the image in an tag.

Question: Which tag is used to create a dropdown list?
Explanation: The <select> tag is used to create a dropdown list in HTML.

Question: Which of the following is the correct way to link an external CSS file in HTML?
Explanation: The correct way to link an external CSS file is using <link rel='stylesheet' href='styles.css'>.

Question: What is the correct HTML element to define important text?
Explanation: The <strong> tag is used to define important text, which typically appears bold.

Question: Which tag is used to define a hyperlink?
Explanation: The <a> tag is used to define a hyperlink in HTML.

Question:
What does the
tag do in HTML?
Explanation:
The
tag is used to insert a line break in the text.

Question: Which of the following is the correct tag to define a division or section in HTML?
Explanation: The <div> tag is used to define a division or section in HTML.

Question: Which HTML tag is used to define an input field?
Explanation: The <input> tag is used to define an input field in HTML.

Question: Which of the following tags is used to create a checkbox?
Explanation: The <input type='checkbox'> tag is used to create a checkbox.

Question: Which HTML tag is used to define a list item?
Explanation: The <li> tag is used to define a list item in both ordered and unordered lists.

Question: What is the default value of the <input type='radio'>?
Explanation: By default, the <input type='radio'> is unchecked unless specified.

Question: Which tag is used to define the metadata of an HTML document?
Explanation: The <meta> tag is used to define metadata (such as author, keywords) in HTML.

Question: What does the <title> tag define in HTML?
OptionA: The title of the web page, shown in the browser tab
OptionB: The main title of the webpage
Explanation: The <title> tag defines the title of the web page, which appears in the browser tab.

Question: Which tag is used to define a form in HTML?
Explanation: The <form> tag is used to define a form in HTML.

Question: Which tag is used to define a comment in HTML?
Explanation: The <!-- --> tag is used to define comments in HTML.

Question: Which of the following is the correct tag to create a horizontal line in HTML?
Explanation: The <hr> tag is used to create a horizontal line in HTML.

Question: What is the correct HTML element for inserting a line break?
Explanation:
The
tag is used for line breaks in HTML.

Question: What is the default value of the `display` property in CSS for an <a> tag?
Explanation: The default display value for an <a> tag is inline.

Question: Which HTML tag is used to define a bold text?
Explanation: The <b> tag is used to define bold text in HTML.

Question: Which tag is used to define the footer in HTML?
Explanation: The <footer> tag is used to define a footer in HTML.

Question: Which HTML tag is used to define a table row?
Explanation: The <tr> tag is used to define a row in an HTML table.

Question: Which tag is used to define a table cell in HTML?
Explanation: The <td> tag is used to define a cell in an HTML table.

Question: Which tag is used to define the header for a table cell in HTML?
Explanation: The <th> tag is used to define a header cell in an HTML table.

Question: Which tag is used to define an ordered list in HTML?
Explanation: The <ol> tag is used to define an ordered list in HTML.

Question: Which tag is used to define a container for external content in HTML?
Explanation: The <object> tag is used to define a container for external content, such as multimedia.

Question: Which tag is used to define a definition list in HTML?
Explanation: The <dl> tag is used to define a definition list in HTML.

Question: Which tag is used to define a definition term in HTML?
Explanation: The <dt> tag is used to define a term in a definition list.

Question: What is the purpose of the `alt` attribute in an tag?
OptionA: To provide alternative text for images
Explanation: The `alt` attribute is used to provide alternative text for an image if it cannot be displayed.

Question: Which tag is used to embed a video in HTML?
Explanation: The <video> tag is used to embed a video in HTML.

Question: Which of the following is the correct way to include an external JavaScript file in HTML?
Explanation: The correct way to include an external JavaScript file is using the <script src='script.js'></script> tag.

Question: What is the purpose of the `<head>` tag in HTML?
OptionA: To define meta-information about the document
OptionB: To define the content of the page
OptionC: To define the footer of the page
OptionD: To define the main structure of the page
Explanation: The <head> tag is used to define meta-information about the HTML document such as the title, links to stylesheets, etc.

Question: Which tag is used to specify a background image in HTML?
Explanation: The background image is typically specified in the <body> tag or using CSS in the background property.

Question: What is the correct HTML tag to include a comment?
Explanation: The correct way to add a comment in HTML is using the <!-- comment --> syntax.

Question: Which tag is used to define an unordered list in HTML?
Explanation: The <ul> tag is used to define an unordered list in HTML.

Question: What does the `target='_blank'` attribute in an anchor (<a>) tag do?
OptionA: Opens the link in a new tab
OptionB: Opens the link in the same tab
OptionC: Opens the link in the same frame
OptionD: Opens the link in a new window
Explanation: The `target='_blank'` attribute opens the linked document in a new tab.

Question: Which of the following is correct for creating a link to an external website?
Explanation: The <a href='https://www.example.com'> tag is used to create a link to an external website.

Question: What is the default font size for text in an HTML document?
Explanation: The default font size in an HTML document is 16px.

Question: Which tag is used to define a clickable button in HTML?
Explanation: The <button> tag is used to define a clickable button in HTML.

Question: Which HTML tag is used to define the title of the document, visible on the browser's title bar or tab?
Explanation: The <title> tag defines the title of the document, which appears on the browser's title bar or tab.

Question: Which HTML attribute is used to specify the source of an image?
Explanation: The src attribute is used to specify the source of an image in an tag.

Question: Which element is used to define a dropdown list in HTML?
Explanation: The <select> element is used to define a dropdown list in HTML.

Question: What does the `rel='noopener noreferrer'` attribute in a link do?
OptionA: Prevents the new page from accessing the previous page's window object
OptionB: Allows the new page to access the previous page's window object
OptionD: Closes the previous page after opening the link
Explanation: The `rel='noopener noreferrer'` attribute ensures that the new page cannot access the previous pageâ€™s window object for security purposes.

Question: Which HTML element is used to define an inline frame?
Explanation: The <iframe> tag is used to define an inline frame, which allows embedding another document within the current page.

Question: Which HTML tag is used to define a definition description in a definition list?
Explanation: The <dd> tag is used to define a description in a definition list in HTML.
